And all the workers . The people there were so nice . Tripadvisor 02/07/2025 Stopped in on a Friday night for the entertainment.
The place was busy and we waited 30 minutes to get a seat at the bar.
The service was very good and I ordered the Shrimp Stir Fry, very good!
The band was excellent!
I look forward to going back when I... Tripadvisor 10/17/2024 Don't go here. We got wings and 4 were broken and they were all drums. Asked the server to fix it,  they REHEATED ALL OFTHE BROKEN ONES, AND SOME OF THE DRUMS WE HAD ALREADY, AND HAVE THEM BACK TO US.   The managers didn't even want to listen to us!  Not... Tripadvisor 03/29/2024 Have been visiting Finley's almost 15 years.  The bartenders are excellent.  I recently had a perfectly poured Imperial pint of Guinness poured by Rob.  I always get a great Guinness pint there.  Only a few establishments in Pinellas County serve... Tripadvisor 03/13/2024 Had turkey stack sandwich with fries.  Good portion, reasonable price and very good.  Ww had an excellent waitress with our large group of women.  They were extremely busy.  Will definitely go back! Changes on Tap for Finley's Irish Pub & Eatery | Largo, FL Patch Skip to main content Largo, FL Subscribe News Feed Events Local Businesses Classifieds Post Advertise Nearby Pinellas Beaches News Clearwater News St. Pete News Dunedin News Safety Harbor News Gulfport News Palm Harbor News East Lake News Westchase News Tarpon Springs News Local News Community Corner Crime & Safety Politics & Government Schools Traffic & Transit Obituaries Personal Finance Neighbor News Best Of Seasonal & Holidays Weather Arts & Entertainment Business & Tech Health & Wellness Home & Garden Sports Travel Kids & Family Pets Restaurants & Bars Real Estate Events Local Businesses Classifieds See all communities Advertise Promote on Patch In partnership with Nearby Communities Pinellas Beaches, FL Clearwater, FL St. Pete, FL Dunedin, FL Safety Harbor, FL Gulfport, FL Palm Harbor, FL East Lake, FL Westchase, FL Tarpon Springs, FL State Edition Florida National Edition Top National News See All Communities Thank you to our Local Business Sponsor: "AWAY FROM HOME" In partnership with Business & Tech Changes on Tap for Finleyâ€™s Irish Pub & Eatery A new owner is planning to expand the Largo bar and menu while keeping the previous owner on board. Jeffrey Rosenfield , Patch Staff Posted Thu, Aug  9, 2012 at 6:21 pm ET | Updated Wed, Aug  15, 2012 at 9:44 pm ET When a new owner takes over a business, changes are inevitable. But sometimes, change can be good. That appears to be the case at , the popular Belcher Road bar known for its blues jam and annual St. Pattyâ€™s Day party. A few weeks ago, previous owner John Hendrick sold the establishment to Mark Ternes , and by all accounts, the transition has been a positive experience for everyone involved. Find out what's happening in Largo for free with the latest updates from Patch. Subscribe â€œJohn built a very nice business here,â€ Ternes says. â€œItâ€™s unfortunate he had to break it up, but now heâ€™s worry free. And heâ€™s going to be a big asset to me.â€ Hendrick, who had to sell due to a difference with his previous partner, hit it off with Ternes and will remain at Finleyâ€™s as a bartender, providing a familiar face for patrons who grew accustomed to his easygoing style. Find out what's happening in Largo for free with the latest updates from Patch. Subscribe â€œI wasnâ€™t thinking of staying on, but as I got to know Mark, we built our relationship and I saw he wanted me to stay on,â€ Hendrick relates. â€œItâ€™s a win-win situation for me and him,â€ he adds. â€œI can watch someone take what I started to the next level, but be less stressed about it. So I feel good.â€ Experience Where it Counts Ternes, a 20-year veteran of the business, has plenty of experience operating bars in the greater Largo area. He ran two thriving establishments on Indian Rocks Beach â€” the Blue Marlin and Marlin Time â€” but he had to sell them both because he was at the mercy of the landowners. He then managed both Mickey Quinn's locations, an experience that gave him a taste of what it was like to operate an Irish pub. â€œThatâ€™s where my Irish started,â€ he says. â€œI went from sports bars to pubs.â€ His familiarity with Finleyâ€™s led him to approach Hendrick when he heard about his situation, and in the span of a few weeks, the passing of the torch was complete. â€œI always wanted my own bar,â€ Ternes said. â€œI found it in Finleyâ€™s.â€ Changes coming Ternes has grand plans for his new place. While the staples of the business â€” the food, the pints, the blues jam and the name â€” will remain the same, he is planning some major changes. â€œIâ€™m taking over the space next door, which will add 2,200 square feet of space and 50 more seats,â€ he said.Â â€œIâ€™m going to put in a stage for the music, pool tables, games and a new bar, and add pizza and flatbreads to the menu.â€ The changes are all designed with families in mind. â€œWeâ€™re doing it so families can come in and bring ball teams. I want this to be a place where you can bring kids after 9 pm.â€ Hendrick is on board with Ternes' plans. â€œI think all these things need to happen in order to take it to the next level. Iâ€™m happy with everything.â€ Finley's Irish Pub & Eatery Address: 13477 Belcher Rd. Phone: 727-535-7858 Hours: Daily, 11am - midnight Get more local news delivered straight to your inbox.
